info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 9:24PM EDT until June 1 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh PA
info.description:
...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania...
Ohio River At Pittsburgh affecting Allegheny County.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Ohio River at Pittsburgh.
* WHEN...Until Sunday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the Monongahela Parking Wharf. At 19.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the North Shore Riverwalk between the stadiums. At 19.5 feet, The Monongahela Parking Wharf is completely flooded. At 20.0 feet, Water is up to one foot deep in the lower areas of the North Shore Riverwalk.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 17.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.1 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY AFTERNOON
